meanings.definition: An introductory section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The prologue of the story set the stage for what was to come.
meanings.sent2: The book began with a prologue that explained the history of the characters.
meanings.sent3: The prologue was like a sneak peek into the world of the novel.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a prologue, leading up to the main adventure.
meanings.sent5: The prologue was so captivating that it stayed with the reader long after.

meanings.sent1: The prologue to the play was a grand musical performance.
meanings.sent2: The prologue to their friendship was a chance encounter at the park.
meanings.sent3: The prologue to the party was a surprise dance performance by the host.
meanings.sent4: The prologue to their relationship was a shared love for hiking.
meanings.sent5: The prologue to the movie was an action-packed car chase scene.

meanings.sent1: She would always prologue her presentations with a funny anecdote.
meanings.sent2: Before starting the meeting, he decided to prologue the agenda for everyone.
meanings.sent3: He liked to prologue his cooking videos with a quick kitchen tip.
meanings.sent4: The speaker prologued his speech with a heartfelt thank you to the audience.
meanings.sent5: To prologue the event, they played a short video highlighting the organization's work.
